page.title: 16THE ECOLOGY OF WESTON
page.content: Many people in Weston have large plots of land and keep them in good order, the{gardens}are picturesque and the {vegetable plots}well cultivated. The village has many trees most of which are deciduous. Much of the partition hedging is well established{hawthorn and there is also some{beech.}The hedges towards Clothall are reknown for their age, dating back as field boundaries to late Medieval times. Popular{garden flowers}include roses, red hot pokers, rock roses, rose of sharon, daffodils, bluebells and crocus. Several houses have{herb {gardens}which include mint, lemon balm, chives and parsley. Today these are used to garnish meals, mint goes well with lamb chops and new potatoes, chives are used in salads and parsley to dress fish. Flax, or linem, is also grown as a decorative plant.
